com.cmput301fa16t5.legendary_telegram

Class RequestStatusActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • AppCompatActivity
      • com.cmput301fa16t5.legendary_telegram.RequestStatusActivity

  • public class RequestStatusActivity
extends AppCompatActivity
    Clicking on a Request in MainRequestActivity should lead to this (if Rider) For a Rider this would be more detailed information like the number of Drivers have offered to fulfill that request. From there they could click on a driver shown in a ListView and go to ContactScreenActivity to see the phone/email and contact them.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancelButtonPressed(android.view.View v)
      Cancel a Request.
      protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Initialize views, set ArrayAdapter.
      protected void onDestroy()
      We want to remove the old adapter on destroy since next time we'll be calling a new onCreate with a new adapter and we don't want to fill the arraylist of ArrayObserver with a bunch of nulls/old adapters.
      protected void onResume()
      If we complete a request we remove it and delete it.

    • Method Detail

      • cancelButtonPressed

        public void cancelButtonPressed(android.view.View v)
        Cancel a Request. Go back, since it's Cancelled.
        Parameters:
        v - Android

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Initialize views, set ArrayAdapter. This view shows the IdentificationCards. We initialize the ArrayAdapter in onCreate because it is linked to a specific ArrayList and does not change (unlike main request activity)
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - Because Android.

      • onDestroy

        protected void onDestroy()
        We want to remove the old adapter on destroy since next time we'll be calling a new onCreate with a new adapter and we don't want to fill the arraylist of ArrayObserver with a bunch of nulls/old adapters.

      • onResume

        protected void onResume()
        If we complete a request we remove it and delete it. Therefore when we go back to this screen we should skip past it to main request activity.
